intro: Ferula insularis, commonly known as the island fennel, is a perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like parsley and dill. The plant is characterized by its tall, hollow stems and feathery, finely divided leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the carrot family. Ferula insularis is known for its strong, pungent odor and has been used historically in traditional medicine.
